metadata.title: CVE-2023-39360 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description: Cacti is an open source operational monitoring and fault managementframework.Affected versions are subject to a Stored Cross-Site-Scripting(XSS) Vulnerability allows an authenticated user to poison data. Thevulnerability is found in `graphs_new.php`. Several validations areperformed, but the `returnto` parameter is directly passed to`form_save_button`. In order to bypass this validation, returnto mustcontain `host.php`. This vulnerability has been addressed in version1.2.25. Users are advised to upgrade. Users unable to update shouldmanually filter HTML output.

criterions.comment: cacti package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
